metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37454 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The Keccak XKCP SHA-3 reference implementation before fdc6fef has an integer overflow and resultant buffer overflow that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code or eliminate expected cryptographic properties. This occurs in the sponge function interface.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial rodrigo-zaiden> PHP includes Keccak code for sha3 starting from php7.2 leosilva> in PHP it was introduced in 91663a92d1697fc30a7ba4687d73e0f63ec2baa1 php-7.2.0alpha1 mdeslaur> Python 3.11 switched to using tiny_sha3, so not affected.

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
pysha3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
